mixer.description: The mixer used to drive the input of the oscillator, taken from the names in mixers entry in the main configuration

lo_frequency.description: The frequency of the local oscillator which drives the mixer [Hz].

SingleInput.title: Single input
SingleInput.description: The specification of the input of an element which has a single input port

mixer.description: The mixer used to drive the input of the element, taken from the names in mixers entry in the main configuration.

lo_frequency.description: The frequency of the local oscillator which drives the mixer.

MixInput.title: Mixer input
MixInput.description: The specification of the input of an element which is driven by an IQ mixer

inputs.description: A collection of multiple single inputs to the port

SingleInputCollection.title: Single input collection
SingleInputCollection.description: Defines a set of single inputs which can be switched during play statements

inputs.description: A collection of multiple single inputs to the port

MultipleInputs.title: Multiple inputs
MultipleInputs.description: Defines a set of single inputs which are all played at once

delay.description: The delay to apply to the digital pulses. In ns. An intrinsic negative delay of 136 ns exists by default

buffer.description: Digital pulses played to this element will be convolved with a digital pulse of value 1 with this length [ns]

DigitalInput.title: Digital input
DigitalInput.description: The specification of the digital input of an element

duration.description: The ramp to zero duration, in ns

HoldOffset.title: Hold offset
HoldOffset.description: When defined, makes the element sticky

analog.description: the analog flag must be a True of False

digital.description: the digital flag must be a True of False

duration.description: The ramp to zero duration, in ns

Sticky.title: Sticky
Sticky.description: When defined, makes the element sticky

intermediate_frequency.description: The frequency at which the controller modulates the output to this element [Hz].

oscillator.description: The oscillator which is used by the controller to modulates the output to this element [Hz]. Can be used to share oscillators between elements

operations.description: A collection of all pulse names to be used in play and measure commands

additionalProperties.description: The name of the pulse as it appears under the "pulses" entry in the configuration dict

time_of_flight.description:
The delay time, in ns, from the start of pulse until it reaches 
            the controller. Needs to be calibrated by looking at the raw ADC data. 
            Needs to be a multiple of 4 and the minimal value is 24.

smearing.description:
Padding time, in ns, to add to both the start and end of the raw 
            ADC data window during a measure command.

outputs.description: The output ports of the element.

Element.title: Element
Element.description: The specifications, parameters and connections of a single element.

feedforward.description: Feedforward taps for the analog output filter, range: [-1,1]. List of double

feedback.description: Feedback taps for the analog output filter, range: (-1,1). List of double

offset.description: DC offset to the output, range: (-0.5, 0.5). Will be applied while quantum machine is open.

delay.description: Output's delay, in units of ns.

shareable.description: Whether the port is shareable with other QM instances

AnalogOutputPortDef.title: Analog output port
AnalogOutputPortDef.description: The specifications and properties of an analog output port of the controller.

offset.description: DC offset to the input, range: (-0.5, 0.5). Will be applied only when program runs.

gain_db.description: Gain of the pre-ADC amplifier, in dB. Accepts integers in the range: -12 to 20

shareable.description: Whether the port is shareable with other QM instances

AnalogInputPortDef.title: Analog input port
AnalogInputPortDef.description: The specifications and properties of an analog input port of the controller.

shareable.description: Whether the port is shareable with other QM instances

inverted.description: Whether the port is inverted. If True, the output will be inverted.

DigitalOutputPortDef.title: Digital port
DigitalOutputPortDef.description: The specifications and properties of a digital output port of the controller.

deadtime.description: The minimal time between pulses, in ns.

polarity.description: The Detection edge - Whether to trigger in the rising or falling edge of the pulse

threshold.description: The minimum voltage to trigger when a pulse arrives

shareable.description: Whether the port is shareable with other QM instances

DigitalInputPortDef.title: Digital input port
DigitalInputPortDef.description: The specifications and properties of a digital input port of the controller.

offset.description: DC offset to the output, range: (-0.5, 0.5). Will be applied while quantum machine is open.

delay.description: Output's delay, in units of ns.

shareable.description: Whether the port is shareable with other QM instances

sampling_rate.description: Sampling rate of the port, can be 1e9 (default) or 2e9 Hz

upsampling_mode.description: Mode of sampling rate, can be microwave (default) or pulse

output_mode.description: Mode of the port, can be direct (default) or amplified

AnalogOutputPortDefSchemaOPX1000.title: Analog output port
AnalogOutputPortDefSchemaOPX1000.description: The specifications and properties of an analog output port of the controller.

analog_outputs.description: The analog output ports and their properties.

analog_inputs.description: The analog input ports and their properties.

digital_outputs.description: The digital output ports and their properties.

digital_inputs.description: The digital inputs ports and their properties.

OctoDacController.title: controller
OctoDacController.description: The specification of a single controller and its properties.

analog_outputs.description: The analog output ports and their properties.

analog_inputs.description: The analog input ports and their properties.

digital_outputs.description: The digital output ports and their properties.

digital_inputs.description: The digital inputs ports and their properties.

Controller.title: controller
Controller.description: The specification of a single controller and its properties.

LO_frequency.description: The frequency of the LO in Hz

LO_source.description: The source of the LO}, e.g. 'internal' or 'external'

output_mode.description: The output mode of the RF output

gain.description: The gain of the RF output in dB

input_attenuators.description: The attenuators of the I and Q inputs

loopbacks.description: List of loopbacks that connected to this octave, Each loopback is in the form of ((octave_name, octave_port), target_port)

RF_outputs.description: The RF outputs and their properties.

RF_inputs.description: The RF inputs and their properties.

connectivity.description: Sets the default connectivity for all RF outputs and inputs in the octave.

cosine.description: The integration weights for the cosine. Given as a list of tuples, each tuple in the format of: ([double] weight, [int] duration). weight range: [-2048, 2048] in steps of 2**-15. duration is in ns and must be a multiple of 4.

sine.description: The integration weights for the sine. Given as a list of tuples, each tuple in the format of: ([double] weight, [int] duration). weight range: [-2048, 2048] in steps of 2**-15. duration is in ns and must be a multiple of 4.

IntegrationWeight.title: Integration weights
IntegrationWeight.description: The specification of measurements' integration weights.

samples.description: The digital waveform. Given as a list of tuples, each tuple in the format of: ([int] state, [int] duration). state is either 0 or 1 indicating whether the digital output is off or on. duration is in ns. If the duration is 0, it will be played until the reminder of the analog pulse

DigitalWaveForm.title: Digital waveform
DigitalWaveForm.description: The samples of a digital waveform

operation.description: The type of operation. Possible values: 'control', 'measurement'

length.description: The length of pulse [ns]. Possible values: 16 to 2^31-1 in steps of 4

waveforms.description: The specification of the analog waveform to be played. If the associated element has a single input, then the key is 'single'. If the associated element has 'mixInputs', then the keys are 'I' and 'Q'.

additionalProperties.description: The name of analog waveform to be played.

digital_marker.description: The name of the digital waveform to be played with this pulse.

integration_weights.description: The name of the integration weight to be used in the program.

additionalProperties.description: The name of the integration weights as it appears under the "integration_weigths" entry in the configuration dict.

Pulse.title: pulse
Pulse.description: The specification and properties of a single pulse and to the measurement associated with it.

intermediate_frequency.description: The intermediate frequency associated with the correction matrix

lo_frequency.description: The LO frequency associated with the correction matrix

correction.description: A 2x2 matrix entered as a 4 elements list specifying the correction matrix. Each element is a double in the range of (-2,2)

Mixer.title: Mixer
Mixer.description: The specification of the correction matrix for an IQ mixer. This is a list of correction matrices for each LO and IF frequencies.

elements.description:
The elements. Each element represents and
         describes a controlled entity which is connected to the ports of the 
         controller.

pulses.description: The pulses to be played to the elements.

waveforms.description:
The analog waveforms sent to an element when a pulse is 
        played.

digital_waveforms.description:
The digital waveforms sent to an element when a pulse is 
        played.

integration_weights.description:
The integration weight vectors used in the integration 
        and demodulation of data returning from a element.

oscillators.description:
The oscillators used to drive the elements. 
        Can be used to share oscillators between elements

mixers.description:
The IQ mixer calibration properties, used to post-shape the pulse
         to compensate for imperfections in the mixers used for up-converting the 
         analog waveforms.

octaves.description: The octaves that are in the system, with their interconnected loopbacks.

samples.description: list of values of an arbitrary waveforms, range: (-0.5, 0.5)

sampling_rate.description: Sampling rate to use in units of S/s (samples per second). Default is 1e9. Cannot be set when is_overridable=True

is_overridable.description: Allows overriding the waveform after compilation. Cannot use with the non-default sampling_rate

ArbitraryWaveform.title: arbitrary waveform
ArbitraryWaveform.description: The modulating envelope of an arbitrary waveform

ConstantWaveform.title: Constant waveform
ConstantWaveform.description: A waveform with a constant amplitude
